#Summary1=(human1) Wikinews interviews Christopher Hill, a former US Air Force fighter pilot, about his ongoing primary campaign as a Republican presidential candidate, his goals and reasons for running, his support of the Republican party, and his views on President Obama's performance ahead of the 2016 elections.
#Summary2=(human2) Christopher Hill is being interviewed by Wikinews, for he is running to be the Republican party presidential candidate in the 2012 election.

#Summary3=(human3) Christopher Hill, a former United States Air Force Officer who now hopes to run for president with the Republican Party, wants to use the platform to help workers "from the heartland of America" who have been let down by "unconstitutional" behavior from "far left" presidents such as Barack Obama.

#Summary4=(human4) A former Air Force officer, running as a Republican presidential candidate, commits in an interview to adhering to U.S. Constitutional law and shifting government focus towards supporting working-class Americans over Ivy League elites, suggesting working-class perspectives from the heartland are necessary to restore national stability.

#Summary5=(human5) In an interview with Wikinews, Christopher Hill, U.S. Republican Party presidential candidate, explains that his reasons for running for president constitute implementing policies that support working class Americans.
#Text=Wikinews interviews Christopher Hill , U.S. Republican Party presidential candidate
#Text=Interview
#Text=What qualifications do you have that will assist you in executing the duties of president ?
#Text=My Presidential qualifications are rooted in my service as an Officer in the United States Air Force .
#Text=I took the Oath to our Constitution at 22 years old .
#Text=I understood it was an Oath to ALL of our people .
#Text=Politicians profess an Oath to this nation but once in office pursue their party agenda and reward their voters .
#Text=As President , I will serve ALL of the people in America , guided by the Constitution .
#Text=Why run for president ?
#Text=Why not run for a lower office that you would be more likely to win and effect change ?
#Text=When I was a young man in Air Force ROTC I was chosen to attend a unique Pilot Training Program called Euro- NATO Joint Jet Pilot Training .
#Text=The Air Force only selected 180 Officers a year from the Academy , Squadron Officer School and ROTC to attend .
#Text=I volunteered for that program because I knew I wanted to be a Fighter Pilot and at the " Top of the Spear . "
#Text=In those days it was all or nothing .
#Text=If you graduated you were assigned a fighter , if you were not quite fighter pilot material you had no response to fly another aircraft , you were washed out .
#Text=Congress has proven itself ineffective as a body .
#Text=To make a difference in America you must have the " Bully Pulpit " and speak to the People .
#Text=The President has that pulpit .
#Text=All or nothing .
#Text=I never wanted to make politics a career .
#Text=Why did you choose to run in the Republican Party ?
#Text=My ties to the Republican party date back to 1979 , when I volunteered for Ronald Reagan and his campaign in New Hampshire .
#Text=In those days I believed there was a difference in the parties .
#Text=Today , like many Americans , I am skeptical .
#Text=I understand third party candidates have no success .
#Text=I hope to lead the Republican party in a new direction for working class Americans .
#Text=How do you plan to get into the Republican debates and make an impact on polls ?
#Text=In order to be invited to the debates , we must raise money and poll nationally .
#Text=This is an effort that is underway .
#Text=Recently we were listed in New Hampshire and nationally with Politics1 .
#Text=If you do not receive the Republican nomination , would you consider running as a third party candidate ?
#Text=No , I will back the nominee of the Republican party in 2016 .
#Text=After that , I may reconsider .
#Text=Other than yourself , which candidates have you supported for president in previous campaigns ?
#Text=Reagan in 80 and 84 , [ George H. W. ] Bush in 88 and 92 , [ Phil ] Gramm in 96 , [ George W. ] Bush in 2000 and , Romney in 08 .
#Text=What are your thoughts on the job Barack Obama has done as president ?
#Text=Specifically , what would you have done differently ?
#Text=President Obama has an agenda that represents the far left wing of his party .
#Text=His use of the Presidency to further this agenda has in many ways been unconstitutional .
#Text=Specifically , altering law once it is passed to accommodate his voting blocs .
#Text=His direction to Eric Holder to enforce some laws and not others is another example .
#Text=Hill at the Lesser - known candidates forum in 2011
#Text=If elected , what would constitute a successful presidency for you ?
#Text=Achieving four goals :
#Text=Term Limits for Congress and the Courts returning government to the People .
#Text=Implementing a Tax System that allows working Americans making under $ 250,000 to keep all of their money .
#Text=Closing Loopholes and putting in place a system that is transparent and works .
#Text=Passing a Living Wage program lifting people out of poverty .
#Text=Returning America to a state of Peace and Security .
#Text=What individuals would you like to see in a Hill administration ?
#Text=I would like to bring People from the heartland of America that make this nation work .
#Text=We have had too many decades of Ivy League elites and Professors immersed in theory .
#Text=Hill ( right ) with fellow 2012 presidential candidate Buddy Roemer .
#Text=Anything else you would like to add ?
#Text=A final thought .
#Text=America is a nation that will endure .
#Text=I believe it is our responsibility to pass on the same opportunities to future generations that were promised to us .
#Text=As President , I intend to keep that promise !
